Give me recipe for Paneer Butter Masala

Ingredients:

For the Paneer Marinade:

250g paneer, cut into cubes
1/2 cup yogurt
1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
1 teaspoon red chili powder
Salt to taste
For the Gravy:

2 tablespoons butter
1 tablespoon oil
1 cup onion, finely chopped
1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste
1 cup tomato puree
1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked in water
1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
1 teaspoon garam masala
1 teaspoon coriander powder
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
Salt to taste
1 cup water (adjust for desired consistency)
2 tablespoons fresh cream
1 teaspoon sugar (optional, to balance the acidity of tomatoes)
For Garnish:

Fresh coriander leaves, chopped
1 tablespoon butter (optional)
Instructions:

Marinate the Paneer:

In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add paneer cubes to the marinade, ensuring each piece is well-coated.
Allow it to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Prepare the Cashew Paste:

Grind the soaked cashew nuts into a smooth paste using a little water. Set aside.
Cook the Paneer:

Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in a pan and fry the marinated paneer cubes until they turn golden brown. Set aside.
Prepare the Gravy:

In the same pan, add 1 tablespoon of oil and another tablespoon of butter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears.
Add tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate from the masala.
Add red chili powder, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Finish the Curry:

Add the cashew paste and mix well.
Pour in water to achieve the desired consistency and bring the curry to a simmer.
Add the fried paneer cubes and cook for a few more minutes.
Stir in fresh cream and sugar (if using) to balance the flavors.
Garnish and Serve:

Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and a dollop of butter.
Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.
Enjoy your homemade Paneer Butter Masala
Give me recipe for Butter Paneer

Ingredients:

500g paneer, cut into pieces
1 cup yogurt
1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste
1 teaspoon red chili powder
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
Salt to taste
For the Curry:

2 tablespoons butter
1 tablespoon oil
1 cup onion, finely chopped
1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste
1 cup tomato puree
1 teaspoon red chili powder
1 teaspoon garam masala
1 teaspoon coriander powder
1/2 teaspoon cumin powder
Salt to taste
1 cup cream
Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
Instructions:

Marinate the paneer in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt for at least 1 hour.
Heat butter and oil in a pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
Add tomato puree, red chili powder, garam masala, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates.
Add marinated paneer and cook until it's done.
Stir in cream and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve hot with naan or rice.
Give me recipe for Palak chicken

Ingredients:

400g chicken, cubed
4 cups spinach, blanched and pureed
1 cup tomatoes, finely chopped
1 cup onions, finely chopped
1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste
1 green chili, finely chopped
1 teaspoon cumin seeds
1 teaspoon garam masala
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
Salt to taste
2 tablespoons oil
2 tablespoons butter
Instructions:

Heat oil and butter in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Add onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chili. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add spinach puree and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add garam masala and chicken cubes. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

Ingredients:

2 cups all-purpose flour
1 cup yogurt
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1 cup water
1 pinch saffron strands
Oil for frying
For Sugar Syrup:

2 cups sugar
1 cup water
1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder
Instructions:

Mix flour, yogurt, baking soda, and water to make a smooth batter. Allow it to ferment for 8 hours or overnight.
Prepare sugar syrup by dissolving sugar in water. Add saffron strands and cardamom powder. Boil until it reaches a sticky consistency.
Heat oil in a pan. Pour the batter into a jalebi dispenser and make circular shapes in the hot oil.
Fry until golden brown, then dip in sugar syrup for a few seconds.
Serve hot and enjoy the sweet and tangy Jalebi!
